text: vietnamese schoon kids can't get enough
of rice paper snacks there's a zillion
of snack creations invented just with a
piece of rice paper we have very famous
banjang noong in the la ban jiangtong in
ho chi minh city and in da nang we have
ban chang get made in various shapes and
sizes these street vendor snacks not
only attract the children and students
but also the tourists let me show you
why it's so popular and how to make this
at home let's begin
there are two components that can be
missed in the making of banjang cab is
the spreading sauce made from shrimp
paste and the dipping sauce made with
beef jerky for the shrimp paste sauce
you heat a tablespoon of oil in a pan
then add a tablespoon of minced
lemongrass a tablespoon of minced garlic
and a teaspoon of minced chili and saute
until fragrant then add a tablespoon of
shrimp paste or mamro 3 tablespoons of
water and a tablespoon of sugar to
balance out the saltiness stir well and
simmer on low until the sauce is
homogeneous and thickened wow it smells
incredible next we will make the dipping
sauce as in many other vietnamese dishes
the dipping sauce is what could make or
break the dish all the secrets are in
here so get your pen and paper ready
heat some oil in a pan and saute a
tablespoon of minced garlic to fragrance
then add 2 tbsp sugar a teaspoon of
sesame oil a tablespoon soy sauce 2 tbsp
of chili sauce a teaspoon of minced
fresh chilies and a tablespoon of oyster
sauce and a tablespoon of minced
lemongrass then add 30 gram of beef
jerky crumbles mix well and simmer until
the sauce is combined it smells
incredible of the view jerky the garlic
and lemongrass in a small bowl mix half
a tablespoon of tapioca starch with two
tablespoons of water stir to dissolve
and pouring slowly to thicken the sauce
stir under low heat for one to two more
minutes until the sauce is thickened
then turn off the heat for the toppings
or fillings you will need some pork
liver pate and this can be made at home
too you will need 200 gram of pork
shoulder which should be divided into
three parts the lean the fat and the
skin cut the potline and pork fat into
thin slices cook the pork skin in a
saucepan with water some salt and a dash
of vinegar you can add a piece of
cinnamon and star onions to remove the
smell then remove and finely dice 200
gram of pork liver
cut into slices and soak in fresh milk
for about 30 minutes to remove the
gumminess then drain and combine with
the pork meat season with salt and
pepper 5 pie powder about half a
teaspoon each fish sauce and sugar about
1 teaspoon each mix well and leave for
about 15 minutes to marinate
shred 5 slices of sandwich bread and
soak in half a cup of milk heat some oil
in a large wok add some diced salad and
onion and saute until fragrant when the
onion turn translucent pour in the meat
and stir well over medium low heat for
about 15 minutes until the pork and
liver is cooked through in a food
processor combine the pork and liver
stir fry
the bread soaking milk and the pork skin
porn to process grease the container
with some butter peel with the pate and
flatten the surface you can pour some
melted butter on top to keep it longer
there you have it delicious homemade
pork liver pate very fragrant rich and
tasty now arrange everything in an
assembly line you will need some coconut
and sesame rice crackers cut into
triangle pieces some pork liver pate
some shredded beef jerky
dry small shrimps quail eggs fried
shallots and scallion the two sauces
that we make and don't forget some sweet
chili jam you can be very creative with
this match and match the fillings and
toppings of your choice let's start with
the pate place the rice paper on a flat
surface press the shrimp paste sauce all
over it then spread the pate at topping
sprinkle with some chopped scallion and
fried shallots some dried tiny shrimps
and grill over charcoal or you can also
use an infrared stove as i do place it
on a rack so it's easier to move around
grill until the rice paper becomes rice
cracker another version of this is you
can wet your rice paper
and then place on a flat surface brush
with the shrimp paste sauce add some
pate
chopped scallion fry shallots and then
roll it up then put on the grill and
grill partially so you can get the outer
part crispy
the inside still soft and chewy with the
creamy pate in the middle and you will
have a bite making heaven next version
will be with beef jerky you can repeat
pretty much the same brush with the
shrimp sauce then top with shredded beef
jerky some chopped scallion and fried
shallots do the same with the roller
version by wetting the rice paper first
brush with the shrimp sauce top with the
fillings fold in the sides and simply
roll up for the quail egg version you
also brush with the shrimp sauce first
add some chopped scallion and pate in
the middle don't forget the fried
shallots make a well in the center and
crack in one quail egg folding the
angles to form a triangle piece
arrange them on a grilling basket and
grill over fire until the outside gets
crispy you can also skip the folding
part and have the quail eggs cooked
sunny side up on top you can mix and
match different fillings or have them
all in the combo version with palte
shredded beef jerky and crayola eggs
they're gonna taste amazing anyway ta-da
with just a little bit of creativity you
can create endless types of grilled rice
paper snacks
really beautiful and taste incredibly
awesome it smells so good and looks
amazing especially when you dip into
that flavorful beef jerky sauce i know
some people call this junk food but well
if they give it a try i'm sure they will
totally fall in love and if you make it
at home yourself it's safer more hygiene
and there's less things to worry about i
hope you get to understand the
vietnamese and danang food culture a
little bit more with this video if you
give this recipe a try don't forget to
share with me a photo on instagram with
hashtag helen recipes i'm always looking
forward to them don't forget to
subscribe to helen's recipe channel to
enjoy authentic recipes and food from
vietnam i will see you there next time
bye
